intro: Didymosalpinx parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered didymosalpinx, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded areas. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
